title: Ticket #3066: create a tool to tell condor that the machine is going to sleep
description:
Some pool administrators have a situation where condor is a guest on a set of machines that may be put to sleep for some reason. They need a way to ask condor to put the machine into the sleeping state in the central mananger even though condor_rooster isn't being used to put the machines to sleep.

This request came from Stephen McGough at Newcastle U. He writes:

    We have a Windows based cluster where we have a pre-existing (to Condor) mechanism to allow computers to go to sleep when idle for longer than a set amount of time. Given that we couldn't persuade the powers that be to use the Condor mechanism to sleep computers we opted to write a small piece of code which posts a replacement class-ad to the collector (using condor_advertise) with an offline status for the box. This is obviously fragile as if Condor itself posts a new class-ad before the box enters the sleep state then the status is lost. Also if anything changes in Condor about how a resource works then our code will be broken.

    It would therefore be ideal if we could have a condor_sleep (or something similar) command which will set up an offline status for the resource.
